ticket.title: Remove non-FAC GitHub CI workflows and CI-adjacent config

tickets.reason: FAC CI projection must be stable before removing all other CI workflows.

in_scope: Delete all GitHub Actions workflow files except forge-admission-barrier.yml and forge-admission-cycle.yml
Workflows to delete: ci.yml, ci-slow-lane.yml, bench.yml, docs.yml, miri.yml, release.yml, dev-release.yml, beta-release.yml, release-plz.yml
Delete release-plz.toml and cliff.toml (release-plz and git-cliff config only served release workflows)
Clean up CODEOWNERS references to deleted files
out_of_scope: Modifying branch protection rulesets (already only require Barrier + FAC)
Replacing CI with local-only equivalents (already exists via apm2 ci run)

ticket_meta.rationale:
GitHub is a projection of CI running on the local machine. As the sole consumer
of this software, running CI on GitHub runners is redundant and produces noisy
failures that waste time. The FAC Barrier + Cycle workflows remain because they
implement the admission gate for PR merges. All other CI (build, test, bench,
docs, miri, releases) runs locally via `apm2 ci run` on the self-hosted OVH
machine.

steps: Update CODEOWNERS to remove references to deleted files
Verify remaining workflows and config are intact

acceptance_criteria: Only forge-admission-barrier.yml and forge-admission-cycle.yml remain in .github/workflows/
CODEOWNERS no longer references deleted files
Branch protection rulesets still reference only Barrier + FAC checks
